message.content:
Here is a Python function that uses regex to extract a three character code from a filename in the specified format:

```python
import re

def extract_code(filename):
    try:
        match = re.search('[A-Za-z]{3}', filename)  # search for exactly 3 alphabetic characters
        if match is not None:
            return match.group()   # return the matched string
        else:
            return None   # return None if no match was found
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"An error occurred: {e}")
        return None
```
You can use this function like so:

```python
filename = "57-1Jn.usfm"
code = extract_code(filename)
print(code)  # prints: 1Jn
```
This function will search for exactly three alphabetic characters in the filename and return them as a string. If no match is found, it will return None. It also catches any exceptions that may occur during execution and print the error message before returning None.
